title: SHM - Relating Period and position for SHM

content.question: Which of the following expressions correctly represents the magnitude of the acceleration of the block as a function of time after time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction D k over m, end fraction, times the sine of, open parenthesis, t times the square root of the fraction k over m, end root, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>D</mi><mi>k</mi></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction D m over k, end fraction, times the sine of, open parenthesis, t times the square root of the fraction k over m, end root, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>D</mi><mi>m</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction D k over m, end fraction, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, t times the square root of the fraction k over m, end root, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>D</mi><mi>k</mi></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction D m over k, end fraction, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, t times the square root of the fraction k over m, end root, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>D</mi><mi>m</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction D k over m, end fraction, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, t times the square root of the fraction k over m, end root, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>D</mi><mi>k</mi></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
